intro: Tripora divaricata, commonly known as the variable tripora, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its branched stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Tripora divaricata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
